channel.title: Quick Question About Voting On RSPS
channel.description:
If I have hotspotshield downloaded, can I vote multiple times on a server, seen as though they don`t have my ip? I`m sure that you can vote once every 24 hours on that ip address, so if they don`t have you IP they can`t track you, so you can vote lots of times?
Please answer my question
Thank You Dclawed.

item.title: Quick Question About Voting On RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

TOR uses certain ports that most voting sites block (if the port is open).

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question About Voting On RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Glad you guys cleared that up for me.

So if it only spoofs your IP as something else, that IP will be inserted into the database so when it uses that same spoofed IP it detects it as already voted.

Read full topic
item.source: Quick Question About Voting On RSPS

item.title: Quick Question About Voting On RSPS
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

Your IP doesn’t change, it’s hidden.

Read full topic
item.source: Quick Question About Voting On RSPS

item.title: Quick Question About Voting On RSPS
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

I’m pretty sure hotspot doesn’t CHANGE your IP, but it does disguise it as another one. I’m not sure that will work.

Read full topic
item.source: Quick Question About Voting On RSPS

item.title: Quick Question About Voting On RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“dclawed, post:1, topic:460065”]If I have hotspotshield downloaded, can I vote multiple times on a server, seen as though they dont have my ip? Im sure that you can vote once every 24 hours on that ip address, so if they dont have you IP they cant track you, so you can vote lots of times?

Please answer my question

Thank You
Dclawed.[/quote]

afaik that will only spoof your ip, providing you with a fake one that’s put into the database so if you go to vote again, it’ll just insert your spoofed ip and see that it’s already in there. My voting systems also record usernames so that even if they change their ip address they still can’t claim time after time.

Read full topic
item.source: Quick Question About Voting On RSPS
